alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 22 at 11:18AM PDT until May 28 at 7:00AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.8 feet, Water covers part of Highway 21 near the intersection with Little Goosmus Creek Road between mile post 185 and 189. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM PDT Monday the stage was 18.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.5 feet. - Forecast...The Kettle River will increase a maximum stage of 20.4 feet Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.2 feet on 05/22/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Swift flowing spring runoff can be life threatening. Cold water shock can cause the loss of muscle function increasing the danger of drowning especially in fast flowing rivers. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Monday evening.this evening at 1130 PM PDT.
